title: He's done it! Huge Arsenal fan Piers Morgan is GAGGED as he dons a Tottenham shirt for Comic Relief
text:
He's done it! Huge Arsenal fan Piers Morgan is GAGGED as he dons a Tottenham shirt for Comic Relief The motormouth broadcaster has suffered "great humiliation for a great cause" Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Lord Sugar delighted to see Piers Morgan in a Spurs shirt Share this video Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! An act of charity can see many people do bizarre things that they'd never do in everyday life. 
Sit in a bath of baked beans, perhaps. Maybe you'll traipse up a massive mountain, or spend all day hopping on one foot? 
But it can also lead you to do unspeakable crimes against your football team - and that's exactly where Piers Morgan has now found himself, all in the name of Comic Relief. 
Let's bring you up to speed. After his initial promise to be gagged for a 24hr Twitter silence in return for a £5,000 donation was instantly met by Lord Alan Sugar , they upped the ante - with Morgan promising to wear a Tottenham shirt if £50,000 was raised. 
Upon hearing the news, the likes of Gary Lineker, Robbie Savage, Rio Ferdinand, Kevin Pietersen, Holly Willoughby, Bradley Walsh, Jamie Redknapp and Michael Vaughan all confirmed they would donate £1,000 for the cause. 
But things got serious yesterday when Spurs striker Harry Kane donated £2,000 - promising to DOUBLE it if Morgan kissed the badge as well. Harry's message to Piers couldn't have been any clearer... (Photo: Christopher Lee) 
Despite not hitting the £50,000 target on the Comic Relief donation page , diehard Arsenal fan Morgan has still gone through with the deed - as you can see by this picture posted on Lord Sugar's Twitter: Just look at the anguish on his face... (Photo: @Lord_Sugar/Twitter) 
It's something Sugar was very pleased to see, as you can see in the video at the top of the page. 
Fair play to Morgan - in his own words, he's suffered "great humiliation for a great cause" - something many football fans wouldn't do.
